My map

In 2019, I was elected on a manifesto that committed to a programme including renewing Hillingdon Hospital, which serves many of my constituents in Ruislip, Northwood and Pinner.
Residents will be familiar with the long-standing care provided by Hillingdon, both for emergencies and for those with long-term conditions. However, the current infrastructure has presented challenges for being able to provide that care to the high standard that we know and expect of the hospital.
Over the last four and a half years, I have campaigned on behalf of my constituents to ensure that we see shovels in the ground at the new Hillingdon Hospital site and, prior to the General Election, we saw that work getting underway.
However, uncertainty has been cast over the future of the hospital rebuild under this Labour Government. A lot of work has gone into securing this project, and I will keep holding the new administration to account to ensure the work that is already underway can and will continue.
